headers.header_text: SFL 221 section 001: Must be taken concurrently with SFL 222

catalog.description: Historical, philosophical, organizational, and curricular issues related to developmentally appropriate practices in programs for young children.The purpose of the course is to link the theoretical to the practical experience gained in SFL 222.
catalog.note: Due to enrollment constraints, SFL 221 may not be retaken to improve a grade unless approved by the Child and Family Studies Laboratory Steering Committee.
catalog.prerequisite: SFL 210 and SFL 240; SFL 222 must be taken concurrently with SFL 221.
catalog.title: Foundations of Developmentally Appropriate Practices in Programs for Young Children.
